sen.j: 四辻 公遠（よつつじ きんとお、天文 (日本)9年（1540年）- 文禄4年8月13日 (旧暦)（1595年9月16日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の公卿・書家。
sen.e: Kinto YOTSUTSUJI (1540 - September 16, 1595) was a Court noble and a calligrapher in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Kinto YOTSUTSUJI (1540 - September 16, 1595) was a Court noble and a calligrapher during the Sengoku period (Japan).
Kinto YOTSUTSUJI (1540 - September 16, 1595) was a Court noble and a calligrapher during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.e: He was a Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
He was a Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
He was a Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 父は権大納言四辻季遠。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI.
His father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI.
His father was Gon Dainagon Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 息子は鷲尾隆尚、四辻季継、猪熊季光、高倉嗣良など、娘は桂岩院（上杉景勝側室）、四辻与津子（後水尾天皇典侍）など。
sen.e: His sons included Takanao WASHINOO, Suetsugu YOTSUTSUJI, Suemitsu INOKUMA and Tsuguyoshi TAKAKURA, and his daughters included Keiganin (concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI) and Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI (Emperor Gomizuoo's Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank)).

His sons included Takanao WASHINOO, Suetsugu YOTSUTSUJI, Suemitsu INOKUMA and Tsuguyoshi TAKAKURA, and his daughters included Keiganin (concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI) and Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI (Emperor Gomizuoo's Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank)).

His sons included Takanao WASHINOO, Suetsugu YOTSUTSUJI, Suemitsu INOKUMA and Tsuguyoshi TAKAKURA, and his daughters included Keiganin (concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI) and Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI (Emperor Gomizuoo's Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank)).
